Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities:

● Craft reports incorporating information (pertinent graphs and charts), insights, and recommendations for digestible consumption of campaign stakeholders (clients or internal members)




● Regularly update internal trackers (e.g., Media Review Sheet, weekly trackers for Globe business units)




● Platform support and implementation for tools used in creating reports for Paid, Owned, and Earned media pillars.




● Provide support to internal members on technical requirements including website and app audit and tag management and implementation. This involves driving the tag development process, supporting a tag management process, and expanding the tagging structure to provide accurate reporting.




● Work with the campaign management and account management/client services teams to ensure that all imperative platform trackers are properly implemented, any new technologies being deployed are understood, and the integrity of the data being collected, campaign objectives, KPIs and reporting requirements are clearly aligned.




Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

● Proficiency in analytics tools

Knows how to access and read data from tools needed to provide quality reports.




● Data Visualization and Comprehension

Understands the correlation of data to be able to plot out comprehensible tables, charts, and visuals for internal teams and stakeholders




● Digital Knowledge

Familiar with paid, owned, and earned media metrics and KPIs; Understands the correlation of metrics resulting in good data analysis




● High quality of insights and recommendations (based on owned, paid, and earned media understanding)

Provides highlights, rich insights, and recommendations which clients can confidently refer to in making marketing decisions




● Data accuracy

Maintains high level of data integrity in reports and trackers that are updated in a regular basis




● Task Management

Works efficiently and manages workload without rendering extra number of hours (except for isolated situations ie. unforeseen events); Timely revert of deliverables, get back on adhoc requests & prompt management of data trackers




● Technical Capabilities

Conducts error-free website audit and provides quality technical support; Knows how to operate tag management tools, manage platform integrations, and understands the technical requirements of the brand/campaign.




Qualifications:

● Knowledge and understanding of the following:

○ Social Media Listening (ie Meltwater, Talkwalker, GWI)

○ Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager

○ Strong knowledge and skills in Excel and Google Sheets.

○ Digital Marketing and campaign optimization

○ Various ad-tech/mar-tech, CRM, cloud & development platforms

○ Reporting and data analysis - platforms and reports

○ Defining key campaign metrics - CPA, CPI, ROI, CLV, ROAS

○ Website/app tracking and tag management

○ Data Visualization

● Strong Mathematical and Problem-Solving Skills

● Strong Data Management and Analytical Skills

● Proficiency with MS office applications, Google Marketing Platform, and digital dashboards

● Strong Communication and Presentation Skills




Education:

● Bachelor’s degree in any of the following: Marketing, Communication, Advertising, Computer Science, Statistics, Math, IT, or any related field Additional Skills and Attributes:

● Proficient in interpersonal skills, both through written and verbal communication

● Skilled with Microsoft Excel or Google Sheet

Title: Corporate Affairs Assistant
Description:
Key Responsibilities


Corporate & Internal Events Administration
Plan and coordinate corporate-wide events, conferences, launches, and internal


celebrations.


Ensure seamless logistics, promotions, and stakeholder coordination for both


internal and external engagements.


Assist in protocol management and representation of the company in public


functions.


Corporate and Community Relations
Assist in building and maintaining strong relationships with key stakeholders,


partners, media organizations, and community leaders.


Represent the organization in community engagements and initiatives to


strengthen public trust and visibility.


Assist in developing partnerships to expand outreach and impact.
Audience Engagement & Educational Programs
Coordinate with the Editorial team and supervise programs to raise awareness


and appreciation for newspaper readership and media literacy.


Assist in facilitating inquirer educational tours, student interviews, and


internship/immersion programs, ensuring informative and engaging experiences

for students and academic partners.


Support and oversee initiatives such as TLC (Tours, Leisure and Chow) and


Playground for Minds to boost readership and strengthen relationships with

hotels and affiliated schools.


Support in the coordination of events for key stakeholders e.g. debates, INQ


seminar series, etc.


Inquirer Foundation & CSR Initiatives
Oversee the planning, execution, and reporting of CSR programs in collaboration


with the Inquirer Foundation—such as Inqskwela and the Calamity Help

Fund—while also developing strategies to solicit donations.


Organize employee volunteerism activities and advocate participation in social impact campaigns.
Assist in CSR-related communications and documentation.
Issues and Crisis Management Assistance
Support the Corporate Communications team during reputational or crisis events


by assisting in media coordination, stakeholder communication, and situational

reporting.


PR Support and Special Projects
Assist in executing PR strategies through content development and support,


event visibility, and stakeholder engagement.


Contribute to the successful delivery of cross-functional projects and initiatives as


assigned by leadership.

Minimum Qualifications

Education and Experience:


Bachelor’s degree in Mass Communications, Public Relations, Marketing, or a


related field.


At least 1-2 years of experience in corporate affairs, public relations,


events/project management, or CSR programs.

Strong knowledge in the state of business and the industry connected it.
Strong written, interpersonal and verbal communication skills.
Excellent interpersonal and stakeholder engagement abilities.
Strong organizational and multitasking skills.
Excellent understanding of corporate communication, CSR programs, CRM and


issues management.


Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced media


environment.


Basic computer operations skills and digital and technology savvy.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
About the Role

The Junior Data Analyst at Evident will provide essential support in collecting, organizing, and reporting data that guides client initiatives and internal decision-making. You will work closely with senior team members to ensure accurate reporting, support data analysis tasks, and contribute to the development of data-driven insights and strategy.




Tasks and Responsibilities

Campaign Reporting

Assist in preparing analytics reports for internal teams and external clients, ensuring accuracy and clarity.
Consolidate and organize campaign data from various platforms (e.g., social media, websites).
Generate clean and error-free reports using defined templates.




Data Collection and Monitoring

Support data collection using tools for social listening, news monitoring, or basic web analytics.
Help maintain dashboards for monitoring key metrics relevant to clients and projects.




Performance Tracking

Assist in tracking performance metrics of digital campaigns under the guidance of a senior analyst.
Participate in basic data cleaning, validation, and visualization tasks.




Qualifications and Skills

1 to 2 years of relevant experience in data analysis, research, or reporting.
Fresh graduates with a strong interest in data analytics and a willingness to learn are encouraged to apply.
Familiarity with data tools such as Excel/Google Sheets, Google Analytics, or similar platforms.
Exposure to (or willingness to learn) social media metrics and simple reporting dashboards.
Strong attention to detail, with the ability to spot errors and ensure data accuracy.
Good communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a team setting.
Knowledge of digital marketing.

Title: Data Quality Analyst
Description:
Important Information

Location: HGC, Taguig

Experience: 3 – 7 years

Job Mode: Contract

Work Mode: Hybrid

Job Summary

As a Data Quality Analyst you will be responsible for analyzing data, implementing automation processes, and leveraging your knowledge of Angular technologies to enhance data analysis and reporting capabilities. You will play a crucial role in optimizing data workflows, streamlining data-driven processes, and contributing to data-driven decision-making .

Responsibilities and Duties


Create detailed test cases that match business requirements to ensure data quality.
Perform data quality checking for ad-hoc data extraction.
Ability to test in a timely manner that meets SLA.
Communicate with Data analyst and Project Management officer to gather and analyze requirements for test case creation.
Support data analyst in peer reviewing data output before user's acceptance (UAT).
Maintain QA documentation/artifacts for future testing purposes.
Perform data testing of outputs made by data analysts to ensure quality using SQL.
Ability to work cohesively in a team type environment.
Attend daily stand-ups for team updates and work progress


Qualifications and Skills


Experience in Quality Assurance (qa testing, terminologies, methodologies, concepts)
Experience working with SQL required
Experience in Google Data Studio, Google Sheets, Excel required
Experience in Google BigQuery, Tableau, Power BI, Metabase, DaaS preferred
Experience in Hadoop or Big Data technologies preferred Experience in JIRA and Confluence preferred
Minimum 3-5 years related experience


About Encora

Encora is the preferred digital engineering and modernization partner of some of the world's leading enterprises and digital native companies. With over 9,000 experts in 47+ offices and innovation labs worldwide, Encora's technology practices include Product Engineering & Development, Cloud Services, Quality Engineering, DevSecOps, Data & Analytics, Digital Experience, Cybersecurity, and AI & LLM Engineering.

At Encora, we hire professionals based solely on their skills and qualifications, and do not discriminate based on age, disability, religion, gender, sexual orientation, socioeconomic status, or nationality.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
ERNI is a fast-growing Software Development company headquartered and founded in Switzerland in 1994, with more than 800 employees. We are highly specialized in IT & software engineering to enable and deliver innovation in process and technology. Our first service center in Asia Pacific is in Metro Manila (Mandaluyong) from where we provide our service to Europe, APAC incl. our local market Philippines, and USA regions. We are now geared towards expansion and are looking for highly motivated joiners.

WHY ERNI is the best place to call HOME? 🏡


🤩 At ERNI, this is how we can support you; ALL company PERKS AND BENEFITS take effect UPON HIRING!

Contract: there is always a project and opportunity for you.
Personal Development and Travel Opportunities outside the Philippines.
Wedding Gift – to celebrate your special day.
Baby Basket – to welcome your newborn to the ERNI family.
Fruit Basket – boost of vitamins during hospitalization.
Free snacks and coffee in the office

🔐 UNLOCKING NEW DOORS OF GROWTH & OPPORTUNITIES

Free Training with Certifications: Grow with us through technical and non-technical training.
Challenging Projects: ERNI is dedicated to developing high-quality software in complex technical environments such as MedTech, Industry, Finance, and Transportation. Have the chance to participate in various technically challenging projects amongst passionate and skilled colleagues.
Employee Welfare: You will be guided by a group of people who will guide and support you to have the right tools and mindset.
Promotions & Recognition: From the very first day, we offer you a way to learn and develop yourself in our company. Your colleagues and superiors consistently recognize and appreciate all efforts, making you feel satisfied with your achievements.
Communication: You will find transparency, honesty, and open communication in our working culture. we value suggestions, opinions, and feedback from all employees.

⏱ FLEXIBILITY

Hybrid Set-Up: We are combining both remote work and in-person work. The hybrid setup will allow you to reduce commuting time and have a more flexible work schedule. This will help you to manage better your work-life balance.

🎉 EVENTS:

We provide many opportunities to connect and build relationships. We are learning, growing, and celebrating achievements together. You will experience a wide range of different exciting activities. What to expect? Leisure Events, Summer Events, Family Events, Social Events, and Year-End Events.

👋 What are our wishes?

Education and Work Experience 

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Information Systems, Mathematics, Statistics, or a closely related field.
General professional experience in analytics with focus on data engineering and visualization, of which the last 5 years are related to the use of Microsoft Power BI. 
Minimum of 3 years of experience on an agile delivery project

Technical Knowledge

Experience with developing AI components is an advantage.
Experience with data warehouse methodologies and data lake agnostic of tool is an advantage.
Strong expertise in data manipulation languages such as SQL, Data Analysis Expression (DAX), Power Query M language

Tools/Software

Proficient in the use of ADO.
Experience on working with enterprise Geographic Information Systems (GIS) or its open-source counterpart is an advantage. 

Certification (if applicable) 

Certification on Azure Enterprise Data Analyst Associate and Power BI Data Analyst are desired.Proven vendor management skills and experience 

Reporting and Coordination 

For the provision of staff augmentation services, the Agency Personnel will take instructions from the Project Manager (ITD) and Product Owner (OSFG) and work closely with the project team, internal and external stakeholders. 
The Agency Personnel will provide any other services as required by the team and ITD supervisor or user unit.

How can you contribute to the team?


The Analytics Data Build and Visualization Developer will be responsible for delivering the right analytics products, to the right stakeholders, at the right time to add value in executing the right decisions for safeguards management. He/She is expected to design, develop, test and deploy end-to-end analytics products using the Power Platform stack, primarily Power BI. This role involves both data build and visualization from data structures in the ISMS ecosystem. The Analytics Data Build and Visualization Developer is expected to collaborate closely with cross functional teams and the stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into a scalable solution.

Scope of Work/Responsibilities

Act as the prime mover of design, development, testing and deployment of local and master data models for ISMS Analytics. This covers the Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) pipeline for the data from the ISMS and related ecosystem of applications.
Manage and tune query performance to achieve optimal model structure.
Create and monitor data quality dashboards. The analytics developer should collaborate with the respective development team and the cross functional business team to address the issues.
Design and implement access models. This includes developing dynamic row level security and protocols for seamless update of BI users.
Collaborate with cross functional team on developing data sharing policies and integrations.
Design, develop, test, and deploy reports, dashboards, metrics, apps, data catalog, monitoring objects, and other workspace objects
Design, develop, test, and deploy advanced analytics products (e.g., prescriptive models leading to forecasts, sentiment analysis results, etc.) with reference to the analytics maturity. Model.
Collaborate with the Solutions Architect, product owners, and stakeholders in implementing products following good practice on UIUX and principles of design for analytics products.
Facilitate demos, User Acceptance Testing, trainings, and hyper care for the deliverables assigned.




Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About the Role:

We are looking for a Data Analyst who can independently deliver data-driven solutions that drive business decisions and client success. This role involves developing ad hoc reports using SQL and Excel, automating MIDAS reports for end-users, and managing research-based projects using Excel Dashboards and Power Query.

As a key contributor to client-facing outputs, you will create impactful presentations that compare client performance against industry benchmarks, providing actionable insights for improvement. You will collaborate with team leaders to highlight our companys value proposition and maintain strong client relationships.

Responsibilities:


Develop ad hoc and automated reports (SQL, Excel, MIDAS).
Lead research-driven projects and build dashboards (Excel, Power Query).
Create slide decks with data insights, trends, and benchmarking analysis.
Manage reporting tasks independently via internal queues.
Ensure data accuracy, maintain query/code standards, and conduct quality checks.
Assist in documentation and training materials, ensuring repository accuracy.
Collaborate with leadership to support analytics strategies and client engagements.



Qualifications:


Strong proficiency in SQL, Excel (including Power Query), and data visualization tools.
Experience in automating reports and managing long-term analytical projects.
Ability to translate complex data into actionable insights for diverse audiences.
Excellent communication skills for client-facing presentations and documentation.
Detail-oriented with a strong commitment to quality and deadlines.
Experience in maintaining documentation and supporting team knowledge sharing.

Title: Data Specialist - REMOTE
Description:
Data Specialist

A bit about us:

We're on a mission to change the tire industry — how it's delivered and how it's experienced. A pioneer in the automotive e-commerce industry, we take pride in our extensive selection of top-name brands and budget-friendly options, ensuring our customers find the perfect tire to suit their needs. As a part of our growing and dynamic team, you'll contribute to our commitment to exceptional service, innovation, and customer satisfaction. Embrace the opportunity to be a driving force behind one of the fastest growing e-commerce companies in the US and apply now!

A bit more about this role:

A Data Management Technician is responsible for ensuring that data is properly organized and stored. They commonly work with large databases or other systems of records, which may be used to store information about customers, products, equipment, etc. Data management technicians typically have a deep understanding of the database software they're using. They may also be tasked with updating new databases or tables within existing databases.

You will work in an entrepreneurial environment where we are constantly looking to learn what our customers need and to develop better ways to serve them.

Eligibility Requirements


Must have experience extracting, organizing, and inputting data into various databases or cloud platforms
Must not have had any disciplinary actions regarding attendance, conduct and/or performance in the past 90 days, and must not be approaching such action.


Responsibilities will include:


Reviewing data for accuracy, completeness, and consistency
Organizing and maintaining electronic records for a company's databases
Maintaining physical security of sensitive materials and equipment
Analyzing data in order to identify trends and opportunities for improvement
Assisting in creating reports and proposals to present findings to management
Provide data assurance and quality support projects to Tires Easy


Attributes to success:


Proven success in building relationships and trust
Comfortable working in a dynamic environment
The ability to pivot based on priority shifts
The ability to comprehend and apply on-the-job training. This training may include learning the company's specific computer programs and procedures.


Desired skills & experience:


Experience with using software programs such as: Excel, Google Sheets, VBA, Java Script, SAP
High speed Wi-Fi connection
Be able to work 8 hour shifts (i.e. PST)
You have a minimum of 1 years of experience in Data entry
You're a great team member with a can-do attitude; you're self- reflective


Please submit resume in English

Title: Customer Experience Officer | Makati
Description:
MedGrocer's digitally-enabled wellness and population health programs, telehealth and medical services, and onsite medical staff work with hundreds of pharma companies and employers to improve the physical and mental health of over one million Filipinos every year.

Here at MedGrocer, you will contribute to innovative healthcare solutions that enhance accessibility and efficiency. Collaborate with a diverse team on impactful projects that improve lives while fostering your personal and professional growth.

The Customer Experience Officer drives our company's growth by leading the efforts to create exceptional patient interactions, making sure their experience is filled with care and efficiency.

Key Responsibilities


Manage day-to-day operations relating to order processing and customer service
Handle patient concerns and coordinate with various teams to address patient requests
Generate and analyze daily, monthly, and ad hoc reports and present to internal and external parties
Establish relationships with clients
Manage team escalations and work plans, audit work, and provide learning and growth opportunities
Collaborate with other MedGrocer teams (e.g. IT) to drive product, system, and process development projects
Evaluate and design initiatives to improve patient health outcomes and customer experience
Implement, monitor, and scale proposed initiatives


Perks And Benefits


HMO for employees
Paid leaves
Medicine coupons
Opportunities for promotion and performance bonuses
13th month pay


Minimum Qualifications


2-4 years leading teams, handling difficult customer escalations, creating and implementing processes, and foreseeing and solving possible concerns;
Preferably with experience working in the healthcare industry, but not required;
Must work onsite in Makati
Show more
HTML:
MedGrocer's digitally-enabled wellness and population health programs, telehealth and medical services, and onsite medical staff work with hundreds of pharma companies and employers to improve the physical and mental health of over one million Filipinos every year.

Here at MedGrocer, you will contribute to innovative healthcare solutions that enhance accessibility and efficiency. Collaborate with a diverse team on impactful projects that improve lives while fostering your personal and professional growth.

The Customer Experience Officer drives our company's growth by leading the efforts to create exceptional patient interactions, making sure their experience is filled with care and efficiency.

Key Responsibilities

  • Manage day-to-day operations relating to order processing and customer service
  • Handle patient concerns and coordinate with various teams to address patient requests
  • Generate and analyze daily, monthly, and ad hoc reports and present to internal and external parties
  • Establish relationships with clients
  • Manage team escalations and work plans, audit work, and provide learning and growth opportunities
  • Collaborate with other MedGrocer teams (e.g. IT) to drive product, system, and process development projects
  • Evaluate and design initiatives to improve patient health outcomes and customer experience
  • Implement, monitor, and scale proposed initiatives

Perks And Benefits

  • HMO for employees
  • Paid leaves
  • Medicine coupons
  • Opportunities for promotion and performance bonuses
  • 13th month pay

Minimum Qualifications

  • 2-4 years leading teams, handling difficult customer escalations, creating and implementing processes, and foreseeing and solving possible concerns;
  • Preferably with experience working in the healthcare industry, but not required;
  • Must work onsite in Makati

Title: DATA ENGINEER
Description:
Data engineers power the backbone of data-driven organizations by building robust systems that transform raw data into trusted insights - delivering a single, integrated view of enterprise data to support performance reporting, lead generation, and customer experience, while enabling smarter decisions through clean, timely, and accessible data, including ad hoc requests.

Responsibilities

Designs and Maintains Data Architecture


Builds scalable and efficient data systems, including data lakes, warehouses, and pipelines, to support enterprise-wide data needs
Designs, develops and generates datamarts, performance reports, dashboards, traditional leads and customized data extraction in line with business needs
Interprets the users’ data requirements and execution of the approved business rules / data parameters
Provides end-to-end support on the Enterprise Data Platform and data tools from gathering requirements, translating business requirements into detailed functional specifications, developing and managing the data life-cycle process
Creates appropriate documentation that allows stakeholders to understand the steps of the data analysis process and duplicate or replicate the analysis if necessary


Ensures Data Quality and Integrity


Implements validation, monitoring, and cleansing processes to maintain accurate, consistent, and reliable data
Conducts data quality / reasonableness testing on the datamarts and reports generated with applied business rules


Develops and Optimizes Data Pipelines


Creates ETL/ELT workflows to ingest, transform, and load data from various sources, ensuring performance and scalability
Discusses with System Owners, Data Owners, Business Data Teams and Enterprise Data Integration Team for any system enhancements in the source application that will impact the data platforms by analyzing the revision / enhancement and conducting user acceptance testing
Works with the IT Team to identify opportunities for process improvements that will include automation of manual process and identify opportunities for data acquisition


Enables Data Accessibility and Security


Provides secure, timely access to data for analysts, scientists, and business users, while managing permissions and compliance
Defines and updates data and report / dashboard access rights including folder restrictions


Supports Ad Hoc and Strategic Data Needs


Supports Bank’s initiative on projects based on defined activities by defining business requirements, conducting UATs, providing data extraction requirements, monitoring project timelines and reporting issues, if any
Responds to custom data requests and deliver insights that support business growth, performance tracking, and customer experience initiatives


Others


Performs other Data Management or Data Platform-related tasks that may be assigned from time to time


Qualifications


Must have a Bachelor’s Degree in Management, Economics, Business. Data Analytics or related courses
Must have 3–5 years of experience in data engineering or related roles
Must have knowledge and background in Data Architecture & Modeling
Must understanding of relational and non-relational databases, data warehousing, and data lake design
Must have knowledge and background in ETL/ELT Processes
Must have deep knowledge of data ingestion, transformation, and loading techniques
Must have knowledge and background in Big Data Technologies
Must have Familiarity with tools like Apache Spark, Hadoop, Kafka
Must have knowledge and background in Cloud Platforms
Must have experience with AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud for data infrastructure
Must have knowledge and background in Data Governance & Security
Must have knowledge of data privacy, access control, and compliance standards
Must have Programming proficiency in Python, SQL, and optionally Scala or Java
Must have Data Pipeline Development skills in building and maintaining scalable, automated workflows
Must have Tool Proficiency or experience in any of the following: Dbeaver, SAS, AWS Glue, Talend, Kafka, Airflow, dbt, Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery, etc.
Must have strong analytical skills to troubleshoot data issues and optimize performance
Must have collaboration & communication skills and ability to work with cross-functional teams and translate technical concepts for non-technical stakeholders
Must be knowledgeable in Data Management Tools such as SAS Data Flux, etc
Must be knowledgeable in Database language such as SQL, SAS Base, SAS Base, OA, SAS Studio, Enterprise Guide, etc
Must be knowledgeable in Data Visualization such as SAS Visual Analytics Tool


Work Set-up: Hybrid (3x a week on-site, 2x a week work-from-home)
Show more

Title: Insights and Analytics Intern
Description:
PayMongo builds the most advanced online payments infrastructure in SE Asia, starting in the Philippines. Over the next few years, we will build a broad suite of products that aims to lower the barriers and remove all the complexities in payments. We are rapidly expanding to serve diverse needs of thousands of business. To continue on this exponential period of growth, we seek to build the best and the most diverse team of thinkers, doers and starters.

As an Insights & Analytics Intern, you’ll join the team that turns raw data into strategic decisions across the company. Over a 3–6 month internship, you’ll collaborate with product managers, engineers, and operators to learn how great startups build and scale data-informed cultures. Expect a fast feedback loop, high-impact projects, and real mentorship from our analysts and data leads.

You will


Work closely with product managers to define product health metrics
Document metrics, definitions, owners, and data sources
Build intuitive dashboards (AWS Quicksight) with concise, actionable insights
Plan and build a searchable internal catalog of key datasets
Define schema, refresh cadence, and plain-language documentation
Help improve data discoverability and consistency across teams
Triage and fulfill short-term analysis requests from Growth, Finance, and Operations
Prototype reports in SQL or Python
Share findings through Slack updates, Loom videos, or mini-presentations



You may be a fit if:


You are comfortable with basic SQL (e.g., SELECT, JOIN, WHERE clauses)
You have strong written communication — can explain ideas clearly and concisely
You are curious and analytical — asks good questions and tests assumptions
You are action-oriented — prefers working prototypes over perfect specs
You are collaborative — enjoys working with cross-functional teammates



You will stand out if:


You have familiarity with Python or Jupyter Notebooks
You have experience using BI tools like AWS Redshift and/or AWS Quicksight
You have exposure to statistics, econometrics, or machine learning
Portfolio of projects, hackathon entries, or independent analysis work



PayMongo is a financial technology company enabling businesses to receive payments online easily. We started the company in March 2019, and we are backed by Silicon Valley's most forward-thinking investors including Y Combinator, Peter Thiel, Founders Fund and Stripe. We are looking for people with passion, grit and the integrity to help us build the future of payments.
Show more

Title: Internal Communications Associate
Description:
The internal communication assistant/associate is responsible for developing and managing corporate communication programs to promote and protect the Company's image and reputation. He or she is also in charge of handling internal communication tools in support of the Company's projects and advocacies as well as to drive employee motivation and love for the Company. The function also entails the crafting of strategic communication plans and managing of events to help the division offices and business units in delivering their business objectives.




Education / Licensure / Certification

Graduate of a four year degree course preferably in Mass Communication, Organizational Communication, Communication Technology, Marketing or Journalism




Behavioral / Personal Excellence

Must be a people person

Thinks out of the box

Is assertive and has the ability to consult and influence

Has good organizational and planning skills with a keen eye for detail and time management

Is self motivated and can work with minimal supervision




Technical

Has outstanding written and verbal communication skills

Has good interpersonal and relationship building skills

Has strong understanding of communication planning and the implementation process

Is versatile in writing for multi media

Has strong understanding of traditional and digital communication channels

Is adept in Microsoft applications

Can do graphic designs, basic photography and video editing

Title: Scheme Monitoring Staff Officer
Description:
Job Summary


Primarily responsible for identifying, assessing, and tracking potential risks that could impact on the organization’s operations, financial stability, or reputation.


How will you contribute?


Monitor Mastercard/ Scheme bulletins compliance and implementation for RCBC potential risks.
Collect relevant data from various schemes for risk analysis.
Prepare regular risk reports and meetings for management and stakeholders. Document risk incidents, mitigation efforts, and follow-up actions. Keep records up-to-date and ensure compliance with regulatory requirements.
Continuously monitor risk indicators and key risk metrics daily. Track the effectiveness of risk mitigation measures. Alert relevant teams about significant risk developments.
Work with departments to implement risk control measures. Assist in the development of risk management policies and procedures. Collaborate with internal auditors and compliance teams.


What will make you successful?


Graduate of Computer Science/ Computer Engineering/ Information Technology or higher in fields such as Finance, Economics, Risk Management, Business Administration, or related disciplines.
Relevant certifications (e.g., Certified Risk Manager (CRM), Financial Risk Manager (FRM), Certified Risk Professional (CRP)) are highly desirable.
Prior experience in risk management, compliance, audit, or related roles. Experience with specific risk types relevant to your industry (e.g., credit risk, market risk, operational risk, cybersecurity risk). Familiarity with risk management frameworks and regulations (e.g., COSO, Basel, ISO 31000).
Show more

Job Summary

  • Primarily responsible for identifying, assessing, and tracking potential risks that could impact on the organization’s operations, financial stability, or reputation.

How will you contribute?

  • Monitor Mastercard/ Scheme bulletins compliance and implementation for RCBC potential risks.
  • Collect relevant data from various schemes for risk analysis.
  • Prepare regular risk reports and meetings for management and stakeholders. Document risk incidents, mitigation efforts, and follow-up actions. Keep records up-to-date and ensure compliance with regulatory requirements.
  • Continuously monitor risk indicators and key risk metrics daily. Track the effectiveness of risk mitigation measures. Alert relevant teams about significant risk developments.
  • Work with departments to implement risk control measures. Assist in the development of risk management policies and procedures. Collaborate with internal auditors and compliance teams.

  • Relevant certifications (e.g., Certified Risk Manager (CRM), Financial Risk Manager (FRM), Certified Risk Professional (CRP)) are highly desirable.

Experience with specific risk types relevant to your industry (e.g., credit risk, market risk, operational risk, cybersecurity risk). Familiarity with risk management frameworks and regulations (e.g., COSO, Basel, ISO 31000).

Title: Financial Analyst, FP&A, Content
Description:
Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services, with over 300 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.

Netflix is looking for finance professionals to join our team. This role will support the FP&A team and manage data-entry, validation, and reconciliation to build accurate financial forecasts. This role will also contribute to reporting and financial analysis that are used to inform important business decisions.

Responsibilities


Execute and manage data entry for forecasting and analysis
Perform data validation and reconciliation analysis
Supporting near-term and long-term P&L forecasts
Supporting key portions of the company's free cash flow forecast
Contribute to presentations and memos that can support financial and business decisions
Prior experience in financial planning & analysis or accounting is preferred. Ideal candidates will have a proven track record of performing financial analysis and knowledge of the forecast submission process.
This person must thrive in a fast-paced environment and exhibit the highest personal and professional standards of integrity and ethics.
Netflix is fast-growing with a flat organizational structure, which means that employees are often asked to perform tasks with a range of difficulties. Candidates must be motivated, disciplined, and able to work effectively autonomously.


Requirements


1-3 years of experience conducting quantitative and qualitative financial analysis
Proficiency with spreadsheet-based tools like Google Sheets or Excel
Experience with managing and analyzing large, complex data sets
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
Sound working knowledge of the related accounting guidance preferred
Bachelor's degree with emphasis on coursework of a quantitative nature, preferably Business, Economics, or Mathematics
Must be amenable to working on a hybrid setup, 2-3 times onsite in our Makati office


Inclusion is a Netflix value and we strive to host a meaningful interview experience for all candidates. If you want an accommodation/adjustment for a disability or any other reason during the hiring process, please send a request to your recruiting partner.

We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

Title: Analyst
Description:
Payments Officer – Processing & Investigations

Summary

Provides end-to-end support to customers, which may include use of standard scripts and specific guidelines and procedures, to handle queries or close sales. Seeks help and/or escalates issues/queries when it is appropriate to do so to help resolve customer issues expeditiously.

Background On What ING Is About (Generic ING Background)

ING Hubs Philippines (ING Hubs PH) is an international part of the ING organization delivering services to many Business Units across the world for both Wholesale Banking and Retail Banking activities. Working for ING Hubs PH means working with the most diverse workforce and where no challenge is the same.

At ING our purpose is to empower people to stay a step ahead in life and business. We believe that sustainable progress is driven by people with the imagination and determination to make a better future for themselves and those around them.

ING is changing what banking is. For you, that means plenty of opportunities for personal growth in a continuously evolving environment. If this is the environment you thrive in, then apply and join us in changing the future of banking!

Job Overview

Payments Settlements Services (PSS) and Wholesale Banking (WB) payments act as a utility unit which service Processing and Investigations functions across different product areas like True International Payments (TIP), SEPA, Instant Payments, MIPs and Retail Payments for Wholesale Banking Operations (WBO) and Retail products in multiple locations.

The ideal candidate reports to a Circle Lead and is expected to interact with Center of Excellence (COE), Global Business Partners and colleagues from various geographies including the counterpart Hub.

Key Responsibilities/ Capabilities


Handle and analyze requests, escalations and enquiries of FI and NFI clients with respect to international payments, domestic and direct debits.
Actively cooperate with other divisions within the Payments Department to allocate escalations and prevent them from arising.
Ensure compliance with the rules and procedures that are prescribed by Risk and Compliance.
Create and follow up files for incoming payments that could not be executed.
Provide recommendations in order to reduce the number of payments not processed automatically and improve quality with the aim of reducing the number of complaints.
Formulate proposals for improvement.
Carry out interventions with respect to FI and NFI electronic payments that have been incorrectly supplied.


Minimum Qualifications And Capabilities


Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
Analytical, flexible, open-minded and a team player
Ability to work under pressure and capable of managing and prioritizing multiple tasks.
Have a client driven approach.
Excellent written and oral communication skills, including the ability to convey complex information succinctly and clearly to clients and partners.
MS Office proficient with the ability to work with multiple applications at the same time.
Results driven self- starter who can thrive in a fast- paced, collaborative, and cross- functional environment.
Superior attention to details
Experience working at a Payments and Cash department is an advantage.


, ING Hubs

Title: Data Analyst - Data Analyst I
Description:
Location: Boston, Seaport

Employment Type: 6 Month Contract

Are you a data-driven problem solver with a knack for financial modeling and capacity planning? Join our team as a Data Analyst I and help shape strategic decisions with your analytical expertise.

🔍 What You’ll Do


Analyze financial, economic, and market data to support decision-making.
Support capacity planning, budgeting, and reporting for operating expenses, capital investments, and resource allocation.
Build and manage financial models to forecast business performance and conduct variance analysis.
Collaborate on the design and implementation of tools/systems to support evolving business needs.


🎓 What You Bring:


Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Engineering, or related field. MBA or similar graduate degree preferred.
0–3 years of relevant experience, ideally with exposure to capacity planning or operations.
Strong analytical skills and the ability to develop complex financial models.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel; SQL knowledge is a strong plus.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Detail-oriented, adaptable, and able to work independently in a dynamic environment.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What is Cirkul?

Cirkul is a rapidly growing beverage technology company on a mission to make a healthier world by helping people enjoy drinking more water.

The team at Cirkul developed an innovative beverage delivery system that makes drinking more water delicious, fun, and personalized. The technology reduces the shipping weight of bottled beverages by 96% and uses 84% less plastic. Cirkul offers its customers 100+ unique flavors, all with no sugar, zero calories, no artificial colors, and a range of functional enhancements online, at Walmart, and other retailers across the United States. Hundreds of thousands of consumers are using Cirkul to transition from single-use plastics and sugar-filled beverages to healthier, better-for-you alternatives.

What is this role?

As a Data Analyst for Cirkul, you will be tackling challenges across Growth/Marketing, Finance, Retail, Manufacturing, Supply Chain, and Customer Support teams to quickly deliver insights through analysis, experimentation and reporting. Additionally, you will develop business processes to scale analytics to support a hyper growth business.

The ideal candidate must be able to roll up his/her sleeves to work independently and own delivery results. He/she must have the ability to prioritize issues under manager’s guidance, deal with ambiguity, seek help when needed and manage conflicting deadlines.

What does an average day look like?

Driving Results:


Design and develop KPIs tracking business performance across departments
Build and automate tools to surface key data to stakeholders across a broad range of data literacy levels


Taking Ownership:


Monitor KPIs to identify potential opportunities to improve company performance


Making Decisions:


Collect, analyze, and explain data to key stakeholders and executive leadership


Cultivating Relationships:


Be a data evangelist: collaborate with both technical and non-technical teammates to supplement decisions with quantitative evidence


Instilling Trust:


Always auditing: build and maintain processes to track data and troubleshoot errors


Customer Focus:


Provide ad hoc analysis and forecasting as needed across a diverse set of teams
Evaluate reporting needs and work with key stakeholders to prioritize overall strategy of the data team in answering company goals


What background should you have?


Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, Finance or equivalent quantitative degree. Master’s preferred
1+ year of experience preferred
Data-driven, detail-oriented individual with excellent analysis and problem-solving abilities
Fluency in data analysis and data-driven problem solving; a track record of using data to communicate results to key stakeholders
Experience with experimentation and statistical analysis
Excellent verbal and written communication skills: the ability to present complex data in a digestible format to stakeholders of all data literacy levels
Fluency with advanced SQL and Python
Comfortable creating dashboards in a BI framework such as PowerBI, Tableau, Looker, or comparable tools
Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously: superb time management and prioritization ability


What do we offer?


Competitive salary based on experience and market
Generous benefits, 401k match, and PTO (even insurance for your fur babies!)
Employee discounts on Cirkul products
New corporate office space with great amenities
Opportunity to work with a best in class team, in a hyper growth company, taking over the hydration industry
A culture that rewards results


Please review our privacy policy here.

Cirkul, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe in hiring a diverse workforce and are committed to sustaining an equitable and inclusive, people-first environment. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status. If you'd like more information about your EEO rights as an applicant under the law, please download the available EEO is the Law & EEO is the Law Supplement documents.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What You'll Do:


Partner with commercial teams to create and deliver Client Business Reviews, including custom analyses, optimization recommendations, media plans and forecasts to improve performance and drive incremental revenue
Design, manage, analyze, and communicate results of controlled A/B tests
Create and share market trends and benchmarks to support in strategic planning
Collaborate with Product Analytics to execute on performance-improving initiatives
Influence the Product Roadmap by sharing client needs and feedback with our product and R&D teams
Leverage the partnership with our Global Client Operations Center to identify ways to improve efficiency in executing tasks through automation or delegation
Develop expertise on a key growth area of the business.
Take ownership over knowledge sharing within the team and building client facing collateral
Troubleshoot campaign delivery and performance issues in time-sensitive, high-impact scenarios
Stay informed on industry trends and advancements in AdTech, analytics, forecasting, and attribution
Effectively communicate with teams and managers on project timelines and challenges



Who You Are:


Minimum 1 year full-time, analytics-relevant work experience with Python; previous experience with MySQL preferred
Native-level English fluency and strong presentation and public speaking skills, with the ability to present and defend complex analyses to both technical and non-technical audiences
Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
Conceptual and practical understanding of statistics and real-world application of statistical concepts particularly in a testing context
Experience with internet advertising technology (tagging, cookies, trafficking) and digital marketing concepts is preferred



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

For employees based in the US, certain roles at Criteo are eligible for additional rewards, including quarterly or annual bonus and restricted stock units. US-based employees receive access to healthcare, dental, and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with company match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, life insurance, family forming and wellness benefits, Flexible Work financial support, learning opportunities, and a robust annual leave plan including volunteer time off and summer vacation days.

The US base salary pay range for this position per year is:

$79,700 - $98,000

Title: Associate Data Analyst
Description:
Posting Description

ASSOCIATE DATA ANALYST, Credit Union , supports organization business and department objectives through collecting, evaluating and reporting member and sales data. With guidance from AVP, Data Analytics and Program Support the ADA will help maintain Arkalytics (DataLake), DNA CRM/BI tool and all data related systems to help research trends, support opportunities and measure program effectiveness; proactively support outreach programs through any type of list generation and providing ad-hoc analysis; ensure consistency within the organization in applying a set of projects and process improvement standards; and share knowledge, provide, and serve as resource to project teams and management on tools, methods and best practices.

The Full Job Description Is Available Here .

Job Requirements

REQUIRED : Bachelor’s degree; a minimum of two years of administrative and/or project/program management experience; effective mathematical, language, problem solving, reasoning, writing and basic to complex numeric skills; intermediate to advanced SQL skills for data extraction and analysis; experience with BI tools (Tableau, Power BI, Looker) and Excel (pivottables, macros, advanced formulas); ability to handle multiple projects and work in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment; and excellent typing, interpersonal and organizational skills. Job #25065-6

This hybrid role requires on-site presence. Employees are expected to work 3 days in the office and 2 days remotely each week.

7/11/2025

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
What is Cirkul?

Cirkul is a rapidly growing beverage technology company on a mission to make a healthier world by helping people enjoy drinking more water.

The team at Cirkul developed an innovative beverage delivery system that makes drinking more water delicious, fun, and personalized. The technology reduces the shipping weight of bottled beverages by 96% and uses 84% less plastic. Cirkul offers its customers 100+ unique flavors, all with no sugar, zero calories, no artificial colors, and a range of functional enhancements online, at Walmart, and other retailers across the United States. Hundreds of thousands of consumers are using Cirkul to transition from single-use plastics and sugar-filled beverages to healthier, better-for-you alternatives.

What is this role?

As a Senior Data Analyst for Cirkul, you will be tackling challenges across Growth/Marketing, Finance, Retail, Manufacturing, Supply Chain, and Customer Support teams to quickly deliver insights through analysis, experimentation and reporting. Additionally, you will develop business processes to scale analytics to support a hyper growth business.

The ideal candidate must be able to roll up his/her sleeves to work independently and own delivery results. He/she must have the ability to prioritize issues, deal with ambiguity and manage conflicting deadlines.

What does an average day look like?


Driving Results: Design and develop KPIs tracking business performance across departments. Build and automate tools to surface key data to stakeholders across a broad range of data literacy levels.
Taking Ownership: Monitor KPIs to identify potential opportunities to improve company performance.
Making Decisions: Collect, analyze, and explain data to key stakeholders and executive leadership.
Cultivating Relationships: Be a data evangelist: collaborate with both technical and non-technical teammates to supplement decisions with quantitative evidence.
Instilling Trust: Always auditing: build and maintain processes to track data and troubleshoot errors.
Customer Focus: Provide ad hoc analysis and forecasting as needed across a diverse set of teams. Evaluate reporting needs and work with key stakeholders to prioritize overall strategy of the data team in answering company goals.


What background should you have?


Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, Finance or equivalent quantitative degree. Master’s preferred
Data-driven, detail-oriented individual with excellent analysis and problem-solving abilities
2+ years of DTC, Ecommerce, and/or Retail experience, preferred.
Fluency in data analysis and data-driven problem solving; a track record of using data to communicate results to key stakeholders
Experience with experimentation and statistical analysis
Excellent verbal and written communication skills: the ability to present complex data in a digestible format to stakeholders of all data literacy levels
Fluency with advanced SQL and Python
Comfortable creating dashboards in a BI framework such as PowerBI, Tableau, Looker, or comparable tools
Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously: superb time management and prioritization ability
Ability to work independently and autonomously, as well as part of a team


What do we offer?


Competitive salary based on experience and market
Generous benefits, 401k match, and PTO (even insurance for your fur babies!)

A culture that rewards results

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Shields Health Solutions, we pride ourselves on our culture of inclusion, kindness, acceptance, and the difference we make in patients' lives every day. We are tremendously proud to consistently be certified as a ‘Great Place to Work’ several years in a row; we’ve been recognized as a Fortunes Best Workplaces in Healthcare™, Millennials™, and Women™; and a Becker’s Healthcare Top 150 Workplace.

Patients are at the heart of everything we do. We are committed to improving lives by ensuring seamless access to specialty medications, better health outcomes, and an enhanced care experience. That’s why more health system leaders trust us to deliver personalized support and comprehensive solutions that make specialty pharmacy more accessible for the patients who need it most. Through our proven Shields Performance Platform, we help drive the financial sustainability of health systems while prioritizing best-in-class outcomes that patients deserve. With a team of leaders in specialty pharmacy, a track record of success partnering with over 80 health systems, and an unwavering dedication to measurable results, we empower health systems to transform their specialty pharmacy into a driver of growth—ensuring every patient receives the best possible care.

As Shields Health Solutions continues to experience rapid growth and expand our partnerships with leading health systems across the country, we’re actively hiring to support our mission. Our expanding footprint means more opportunities to make a meaningful impact in patients’ lives—so we’re looking for passionate, driven individuals to join our team and continue to grow with us.

HYBRID IN STOUGHTON, MA

Position Overview:

Shields Health Solutions is seeking a Data Analyst to join the Financial Analytics team, reporting to the Manager of Financial Analytics. This position involves developing and maintaining dashboards and reporting through Tableau and Excel to provide insight into the organization’s performance. Along with this, the Data Analyst will partner directly with department heads to perform weekly and monthly analyses along with ad hoc reporting to identify organization insight. They will proactively recommend reporting, process, and infrastructure improvements. They will automate business and reporting processes and partner with internal teams to improve workflow. This role offers visibility across the corporate team and interaction with key business leaders to support critical business processes, information generation, and insights.

The ideal candidate will have extensive experience working with complex data, excellent communication skills, and possess advanced-level Tableau and Excel skills.

Key Responsibilities


Perform weekly and monthly reporting updates, ensuring data quality and availability
Be responsible for the development and maintenance of Tableau dashboards and Excel reports
Partner with functional leaders to uncover and capture opportunities to improve organizational efficiency
Proactively identify and communicate new ideas or enhancements to existing reports, metrics, and analyses to measure and track business performance
Assist in developing automated reporting processes to streamline analysis
Become a subject matter expert and make recommendations to impact tracking of information necessary to drive business results
Develop and maintain technical documentation to describe and memorialize information with respect to systems, reporting or data
Troubleshoot reporting and process issues, test and work with business to resolve any issues
Support team & organizational goals as needed


Education & Experience


2+ years of experience as data or business intelligence analyst, developer, or engineer
2+ years of developing dashboard, reporting and data processes using Tableau and Tableau Prep
Experience in communicating insight and technical processes to non-technical and executive audiences
Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills
Experience in owning reporting products and driving development projects
Must be a highly motivated, results-driven professional with an entrepreneurial attitude who can thrive in a team-oriented environment
Growth-oriented and positive, problem-solving mindset
Highly analytical with strong attention to detail; methodical thinker
Effective at multi-tasking; someone who enjoys and thrives wearing multiple hats at once, seeks exposure to different perspectives, and learning new skills
Customer service oriented, flexible and adaptable with proven ability to solve problems in a collaborative manner with strong ability to influence
Experience with Python and R a plus


Education:


Bachelor’s Degree in STEM, finance, business administration, or computer science required
Advanced degree a plus


California residents employed by or applying for work at Shields have certain privacy rights. Please review our: California Workforce Privacy Notice and Privacy Policy.

Shields Health Solutions provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Business Intelligence Analyst

Job Location: Marlborough MA 01752

Onsite Requirements: Hybrid

3+ years of experience in Business Analysis or BI roles, with a focus on Data Warehousing and Power BI.
Proficient in Power BI (Power Query, DAX, Power BI Service, and Dataflows).
Strong SQL skills and understanding of data modeling (star/snowflake schemas).

Job Description:

Responsibilities:

Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and understand business data requirements.
Design, document, and validate data models and business logic within Data Warehouses.
Build and maintain interactive dashboards, reports, and visualizations in Power BI.
Translate business questions into technical queries using DAX and SQL.
Perform data profiling, cleansing, and validation to ensure high data quality.
Develop KPIs, metrics, and performance indicators aligned with business goals.
Automate reporting and analysis processes to increase efficiency and accuracy.
Conduct user training and provide ongoing support for Power BI users.
Work closely with data engineers and architects to ensure optimal data structure and ETL performance.
Monitor and troubleshoot data refresh issues and data integrity concerns in Power BI Service.

Required Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in computer science, Information Systems, Business Analytics, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in Business Analysis or BI roles, with a focus on Data Warehousing and Power BI.
Proficient in Power BI (Power Query, DAX, Power BI Service, and Dataflows).
Strong SQL skills and understanding of data modeling (star/snowflake schemas).
Hands-on experience working with cloud-based and on-prem data platforms (e.g., Azure Synapse, SQL Server or similar).
Knowledge of ETL processes and tools (SSIS, ADF, or similar)

**3rd party and subcontract staffing agencies are not eligible for partnership on this position. 3rd party subcontractors need not apply.
This position requires candidates to be eligible to work in the United States, directly for an employer, without sponsorship now or anytime in the future**

Title: Insight Data Analyst
Description:
Your role at Dynatrace

As a Data Analytics Consultant II, you’ll work with some of the largest sites on the web across major industries (retail, auto, finance, travel, etc.) and help to answer questions about site performance and user engagement, which drives improved customer experience for their customers and improves the client’s overall business.

Dynatrace’s tools generate mountains of data, a lot of which clients don’t know how to make use of…that’s where you come in. You will turn that mountain of data into invaluable insight. As someone who lives and breathes data, analysis and problem solving, you will help your clients understand the right performance data, in the right context. You’ll turn that data into business altering insight which enables your client to take the right action to improve overall site performance and user experience that maximizes business outcomes.

You will help clients set a strategy for how they can optimize both their current performance and build performance into their culture. Responsibilities include:


Account management for up to 8 clients, including managing the relationship and customer expectations, providing value and helping to grow your accounts; running all customer touchpoint meetings
Working as an extension of your client's team and the Dynatrace product through ad-hoc analysis, testing initiatives, configuring Dynatrace offerings to get to answers faster, and training and enablement
Creating detailed analysis for your clients by finding answers from the Digital Experience and Business Analytics data through reporting, dashboarding, or technology expertise
Representing your client within the rest of Dynatrace for Digital Experience Monitoring (DEM) issues
Additional responsibilities include working with our team to improve process, identify training gaps and share ideas


What Will Help You Succeed

Minimum Requirements:


Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics or other quantitative disciplines is required.
3- 5 years of experience with data analysis, including looking at and distilling complex sets of data and presenting findings in an engaging way


Preferred Requirements:


Experience in data driven analysis - excellent at working with, understanding, analyzing data
Strong understanding of web technologies including HTML, JS, CSS, networking, Content Delivery Networks, Cloud; basic understanding of Chrome Dev and Webpage test
Proficient with analysis tools including Google Analytics, Adobe, Advanced Excel, Tableau, SPSS, R, etc.
Stellar conceptualization and communication skills. Demonstrated ability to bring business and technical people together around clear product concepts, and to motivate them to deliver whole, working solutions
Operates with a customer first focus
Proven ability to work under pressure and to handle multiple conflicting priorities
Recognizes and understands both personal and team dynamics and relationships, is empathetic to stakeholder concerns and effectively influences and persuades
Thinks proactively and tries to develop solutions rather than wait for an answer
Has a desire to learn new technology and deliver successful customer and partner outcomes for stakeholders at all levels
Possesses excellent organizational, problem-solving, and analytical skills with a keen attention to detail


Expectation: all Insights team members are expected to travel at least 1 time per year for annual team meetings.

Why you will love being a Dynatracer


A one-product software company creating real value for the largest enterprises and millions of end customers globally, striving for a world where software works perfectly.
Working with the latest technologies and at the forefront of innovation in tech on scale; but also, in other areas like marketing, design, or research.
A team that thinks outside the box, welcomes unconventional ideas, and pushes boundaries.
An environment that fosters innovation, enables creative collaboration, and allows you to grow.
A globally unique and tailor-made career development program recognizing your potential, promoting your strengths, and supporting you in achieving your career goals.
A truly international mindset with Dynatracers from different countries & cultures all over the world, and English as the corporate language that connects us all
A culture that is being shaped by the diverse personalities, expertise, and backgrounds of our global team.

Please review the Dynatrace privacy policy here: https://www.dynatrace.com/company/trust-center/policies/recruitment-privacy-notice

Title: Clinical Data Analyst- w2 or 1099
Description:
need local candidates

Seeking a highly skilled Data Analytics Specialist for a 6+ month highly extendable role for one of my Pharma clients in Boston. Hybrid - 3 days onsite work per week required.

REQUIREMENTS:

3+ years experience analyzing and manipulating data
Bachelors degree in a Scientific, computer science or Allied Health field
Pharma/Biotech/Health industry (GxP) experience required
Very strong Python scripting, coding and troubleshooting experience
Strong Power BI, Smartsheet, AWS, Excel experience
Must have extensive experience creating and maintaining complex dashboards with data from various multiple sources
Extensive experience developing and generating Metrics, KPIS, Dashboards and Ad Hoc Reports
Veeva & Snowflake experience a big plus
Automation and integration experience
Stakeholder relationship experience

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

Lead automation and integration of CDMO data sources, building pipelines, data mappings, and validation processes to ensure upstream data integrity and audit readiness.
Build and maintain Power BI dashboards to track batch disposition, deviation trends, closure timelines, and QMS performance.
Improve reporting efficiency by 75% through Python- and AWS-based automation for data transformation, cleaning, and aggregation.
Implement structured data pipelines across systems including Smartsheet, Veeva QMS, and Power BI, enabling real-time operational reporting.
Create a custom internal application using Microsoft Graph API and Azure App Registration to automate file uploads, organize documentation, andenable dynamic permissions for stakeholder access.
Coordinate, investigate and resolve data discrepancies, ensuring consistent and reliable reporting inputs.
Conduct data validation and quality checks to support audit documentation and internal reporting accuracy.
Optimize dashboard performance through Power BI query improvements
Maintain internal documentation of data processes, dashboard logic, and reporting cadences to support reproducibility and stakeholder transparency.

Title: Operations Data Analyst
Description:
Financial Analyst

Hybrid, Framingham, MA

Project at least 6 months



Hourly rate: $35.00-40.00/hr



Must have:

Bachelors degree

3-8 years of experience in a Financial Analyst position

Power BI, specifically creating dashboards

Excel - Look ups, pivot tables, formulas



Overview:

We are seeking a skilled Financial Analyst to join our National Operations Team. This role focuses on enhancing the efficiency and effectiveness of our reporting processes that directly support field and local teams.



Responsibilities:

-Collaborate with various business partners to gather data from multiple datasets.

-Identify new reporting opportunities and develop reports based on business requirements.

-Design insightful reports and databases to facilitate data-driven decision-making.

-Provide training to end users on how to effectively utilize reporting tools.

-Document the process flow of reporting procedures for clarity and consistency.

-Demonstrate proficiency in data analysis, identifying correlations, and translating insights into actionable operational and financial controls.

-Manage special projects and additional responsibilities as assigned.

-Support ad-hoc reporting requests as necessary.

-Work closely with the business to enhance data collection methods and ensure data quality.





#AFHR

Title: Analyst, Data Reconciliation
Description:
Join a fast-growing company that is transforming its industry! Financial Recovery Technologies has become a trusted partner to hedge funds, mutual funds, custodians, sovereign wealth funds, and other institutional investment firms, and our best-in-class people and technology have made FRT a market leader. As a Data Reconciliation Analyst, you will own the reconciliation of financial transaction data which is at the heart of our recovery efforts and our ability to provide the information which allows the top financial institutions in the world to make informed decisions about whether and how to pursue recovery opportunities after portfolio losses.

The Role: As a Data Reconciliation Analyst, you will:


Dig deeply into clients’ equity and/or fixed income trading history and end of day holdings data to perform reconciliation, identify data gaps, and find potential solutions.
Understand corporate actions (Stock Split, Mergers, IPO, etc.) and their impact on clients’ trading history.
Help build tools and processes to improve and scale the data reconciliation competency.
Build strong relationships with peers across corporate functions including:
Data Integration and Client Services professionals, who you’ll work with to provide feedback on imported client data.
Operations professionals, who will rely on your analysis skills in determining eligibility and funds recovery, filing claims, and remediating deficiencies.
Product and technology teams, who will count on you to serve as a resource as they develop technology to support operational requirements.
Quickly and accurately extract, load, and transform client data.
Use ETL tools to load FRT client data.
Develop SQL programming/scripting experience, specifically in Oracle SQL
Be a source of new business requirements that can be used to automate data loading processes.
Identify and communicate data quality issues.
Quickly synthesize issues for colleagues to look at/resolve.
Document gaps in existing processes
Verify quality of client data through existing processes

Our Ideal Candidate Has


Deep analytical experience, including hands on work processing information and testing assumptions - a minimum of 5 years overall professional experience is necessary.
A bachelor’s degree in a Business or Quantitative field (or 3-5 years of experience in a data-driven role)
Solid experience in financial services (experience in a trading environment would be a plus!), as well as strong SQL skills.
Demonstrated experience analyzing and reconciling financial transaction data.
Knowledge of database and data storage concepts
A willingness to work with messy data, approaches it as if it’s a fun puzzle to solve.
Self-direction and detail orientation, with strong analytical, problem solving, and creative thinking skills.
A team-first approach, prioritizing collaboration over credit, and interested in building strong relationships with peers across corporate functions.
The mind of a planner, identifying and analyzing problems, proposing solutions, and anticipating future problem areas before initiating action
Experience evaluating existing processes and developing effective process improvements.
Self-confident enough to execute on tasks independently, trust his/her judgment, and yet know when to ask questions.
An intellectually curious personality and a demonstrated commitment to continuous improvement
Of course, a desire to join a growing company with a vibrant, entrepreneurial culture.


What Does FRT Offer


Competitive salary and bonus ($60,000-$80,000 base)
Health, dental, vision
401k (with company match)
Income protection plans (life, accidental death, and dismemberment, short- and long-term disability) and access to a suite of voluntary benefits
Commuter Benefits
Employee Assistance Program
Fun, smart, diverse colleagues
We are a hybrid company. In office we offer:
Close to public transit (walking distance to Wellington T on the Orange Line
Free drinks and snacks
Free parking onsite
Free access to onsite gym

THIS POSITION IS BASED IN OUR MEDFORD, MA HEADQUARTERS. LOCAL CANDIDATES ONLY, PLEASE.

We are note working with agencies for this requisitions

FRT provides equal employment opportunities by recruiting, hiring, training and promoting applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, creed, national origin, citizenship status, sex, age, ancestry, sexual orientation, genetics, pregnancy, marital or partnership status, gender identity/expression, disability, handicap, status as a victim of domestic violence or other similar offenses, consumer credit history, unemployment, military obligations, veteran status or any other category protected by law.

FRT is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the application or employment process, please let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.
